thread.title: Panthers get early wake up when fire alarm goes off at hotel
thread.title_full: Panthers get early wake up when fire alarm goes off at hotel

title: Panthers get early wake up when fire alarm goes off at hotel
text:
Carolina Panthers get early wake-up call when fire alarm goes off at hotel THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   12:20 pmLast   12:20 pm   
Organizations: 
Washington (790) 

SEATTLE — The Carolina Panthers got an unexpectedly early wake-up call on Sunday morning when the fire alarm went off at their downtown Seattle hotel prior to their game against the Seahawks. 
The Panthers posted a statement on their website saying an alarm "was pulled" around 5:40 a.m. PDT, about 7½ hours prior to kick-off against the Seahawks. The team said players and staff were evacuated from the hotel and by 6 a.m. everyone was given clearance to return to their rooms. 
A number of Panthers players tweeted about the alarm. Charles Tillman posted "Whoever pulled the fire alarm on the 16th floor....not cool." 
The Panthers (4-0) are trying to reach 5-0 for the second time in franchise history. 
AP NFL websites: http://pro32.ap.org and http://twitter.com/AP_NFL
